Kibet is 26 years old and a resident of Litein in South Rift Kenya. He is a farmer, which he has been doing for eight years.  He employs one farmhand. His farm produces tea and milk which he sells to the local market.

Kibet is requesting a loan for 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to buy a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit. He hopes to build a strong foundation for his future family and earn additional income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de venta de ropa pero no le fue muy bien,pero ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia hace desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restraurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,pollo,carne y verduras y tambien para comprar cerveza y gaseosa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She used to sell clothes but didn't do too well in this business so now is in the restaurant business.  She makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners and supports her children through this business.  Her dream is to expand the restaurant business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook like rice, chicken, meat and vegetables and also to buy beer and soft-drinks.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook and also to buy beer and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es: El señor Santos, es soltero, tiene 44 años de edad,  vive en casa de un familiar y se dedica a la Elaboración y venta de ladrillos, leña, piedra y tierra el cual traslada en su carreta la que es alada por un caballo, ya tiene 9 años en este negocio donde ya cuenta con clientes fijos que siempre lo buscan para comprarle y ellos lo recomiendan a otras personas, debido a que su caballo ya esta viejo y no quiere maltratarlo, esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 5,000.00 para la compra de un caballo, su sueño es poder encontrar una persona conquien compartir su vida y poder tener hijos, Espera que Prisma pueda apoyarle.
texts.en: Santos, 44, is single.  He lives in a relative's house and works making and selling bricks, firewood, stone and soil which he transports in his horse-drawn cart.  He's been in this business for nine years now and has regular customers who always seek him out to buy from him and they recommend him to others.  Because his horse is old and he does not want to mistreat him, he's asking for a L.5,000.00 loan to buy a horse; his dream is to find a person to share his life with and to have children.  He hopes Prisma will be able to help him.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Maria Xiomara

texts.es: La señora Maria, se dedica a su negocio de Elaboracion y venta de tortillas, desde muy pequeña su mama le enseño esta actividad y como no tuvo los medios para estudiar continuo con el negocio, con su compañero de hogar tuvieron varios hijos los cuales gracias al esfuerzo de ambos los sacaron adelante con los estudios, actualmente tiene dos hijas que depende de ella. Su negocio comienza desde muy temprano a las 2:00 am y termina a las 6:00 am ya que a partir de las 7:00 am comienza a entregar las tortillas de manera ambulante es una colonia muy populosa de la ciudad, donde ya cuenta con clientes fijos que le encargan, su hija que estudia por la tarde le ayuda en la entrega de las tortillas. Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno y construir su vivienda y vivir tranquilamente cuando ya no pueda continuar su negocio. Esta solicitando credito por valor de L. 12,000.00 para comprar maiz, leña y cal para su negocio.
texts.en:
María makes tortillas to sell.  Her mother taught her this activity when she was still little and since she did not have the necessary resources to go to school she continued with the business.  She and her spouse have had several children who thanks to both their effort they were able to raise and provide schooling for.  She currently has two daughters who still depend on her.

Her business starts very early at 2:00am and ends at 6:00am since starting at 7:00am she goes out to sell her tortillas in an ambulatory fashion in one of the city’s most populous neighborhoods where she has regular customers who place orders with her.  Her daughter who attends school in the afternoon helps her deliver the tortillas.  

Her dream is to be able to buy a piece of land and to build her house to live in peace once she’s unable to continue with her business.  She’s asking for a L.12,000.00 loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder for her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime powder.

loans.name: Pabla Norma

texts.es: Pabla Norma es una emprendedora que ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el crédito anterior fue para el negocio lo cual la emprendedora nos expresa que con el apoyo ha aumento su mercadería y de igual manera sus clientes. Actualmente la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento pero en esta ocasión es para realizar algunas remodelaciones  a su vivienda, con el crédito comprara perlines, zinc, cemento, arena entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Pabla Norma is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundación León 2000.  Her previous loan was for her business and she mentions that it helped her increase merchandise and customers.  Currently, she's asking for funding but on this occasion it's to do some home improvements.  She will use the loan to buy purlines, metal sheeting, cement and sand, among other building materials and supplies.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Amparo Alexandra

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar vive la señora Amparo, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 5 años el  mismo que este año empieza a estudiar en escuela. El marido se dedica a la cría de animales. 

Ella junto al esposo se dedican a la cría de pollos para lo cual tienen dos galpones en los cuales cada quince días meten hasta 200 pollos los mismos que los crían y luego los venden a comerciantes que los revenden en distintos mercados de la ciudad, su esposo lleva más de 8 años con este negocio que esto les da lo suficiente para salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los mismos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es tener un carro o un camión.
texts.en:
The “Las Piedras” communal bank meets every two weeks in a neighborhood known as Las Piedras in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo which is known for its traditional culture, the joy of its residents and the feast days of Saints Peter and Paul.

Amparo, 26, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has a five-year-old son who will start school this year.  Her husband raises animals.

She and her husband raise chickens.  They have two sheds for this purpose that they place up to 200 chicks into every two weeks to raise themselves that they later sell to merchants who resell them in various markets in the city.  Her husband has been in this business for over 8 years and it produces enough to get ahead.

She will use this loan to buy chicks, feed and medicine for them.  She’s been in the communal bank since its founding and she likes it because of the assistance and the benefits she gets from the bank.  Her dream is to own a car or a truck.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and medicine for them.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, vive con su esposo y una hija de 18 años, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, la tiene en su propia casa, atiende las labores del hogar como ama de casa y al mismo tiempo está pendiente de sus cerdos, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un cerdo y concentrado para alimentar a los demás, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar la granja y a tener seguro el alimento para los mismos cerdos. 
La aspiración e Dolores es ampliar la granja, para tener más oportunidades de ventas, para generar más ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores lives with her husband and an 18-year-old daughter. She raises pigs for a living, having them in her own house. She attends to the household chores as a housewife and at the same time she takes care of her pigs, a trade she learned from her parents. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a pig and pig feed for the other ones. This purchase will help her enlarge the farm and secure the food for the pigs.
 
Dolores' aspiration is to expand the farm, in order to have more sales opportunities and to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a pig and pig feed

loans.name: Dolores Elisabeth

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 46 años de edad, está separada pero de una relación que tuvo tres hijos, todos mayores de edad que estudian en universidad y  aun vive con ella. 

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que para salir adelante se dedica a varias actividades,  trabaja en un jardín de infantes y también se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja los fines de semana en sus ventas aunque también vende en el lugar de trabajo, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva cinco años dedicada al comercio  y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes  tanto de hombres como de mujeres.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The “Las Piedras” communal bank meets every two weeks in a neighborhood known as Las Piedras in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo which is known for its traditional culture, the joy of its residents and the feast days of Saints Peter and Paul.

We got to know Dolores, 46, here. She’s separated but while in a relationship she had three children who are all adults now attending university and still living with her.

She is a very tenacious woman who in order to get ahead carries out a variety of activities.  She works in a Kindergarten and also sells Yanbal and Avon brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She works on her sales during the weekend although she also sells at her place of employment.  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly.  She’s been in commerce for five years and does very well.  What she sells most is perfume both for men and for women.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics.  She’s been in the communal bank since its founding and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot.  Her dream is that her children complete their studies and become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Irene Elalith

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar vive la señora Irene, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, una mayor de edad y el menor de 16 años que estudian en universidad y colegio. El marido trabaja en un bus.
 
Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a vender  ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local,  Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o cada mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende es ropa de mujer.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de playa. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda y atención que le brindan en la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un local comercial para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The “Las Piedras” communal bank meets every two weeks in a neighborhood known as Las Piedras in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo which is known for its traditional culture, the joy of its residents and the feast days of Saints Peter and Paul.

Irene, 42, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children.  One is an adult and the younger one is 16 years old; they attend university and secondary school.  Her husband works in a bus.

In order to earn a little on her own, she sells all types of clothes door to door and also at home where she has a small locale.  She works every day selling her products on credit and collecting payment every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil every two weeks or monthly to buy merchandise according to what she needs.  She’s been in this activity for a year and does very well; what she sells the most is women’s clothes.

She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and beach wear.  She’s been in the communal bank since its founding and likes it because of the help and customer service the institution provides her.  Her dream is to have a store to sell her products in.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es: La señora Aura se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 25 años, comienza muy temprano para ir a moler el maiz y luego comenzar a elaborar las tortillas ya que tiene que entregar varios pedidos a sus clientes quienes le visitan en su casa todos los dias de la semana a partir de las 7:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm, esta casada y tiene tres hijos quienes le ayudan a repartir las tortillas, desde pequeña comenzo en esta actividad y gracias a los ingresos obtenidos ha mantenido a sus hijos y le ha realizado mejoras a su vivienda. Esta solicitando credito por valor de L. 12,000.00 para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y como su vivienda es de madera y ya esta dañada necesita una parte del prestamo para la compra de madera y hacer el cambio.
texts.en:
Aura makes tortillas to sell, an activity she’s been in for 25 years.  She starts very early to go grind the corn and start to make tortillas that she has to deliver to several customers who place orders with her and come by her house every day of the week starting at 7am and continuing until 7pm.

She’s married and has three children who help her deliver the tortillas.  She started with this activity while still a little girl and thanks to income obtained has been able to support her children and to do some home improvements.

She’s asking for a L. 12,000.00 loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder.  Because her house is wood and it’s in need of repair, she needs part of the loan to buy wood to replace it.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime powder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy water pipes and chemicals

loans.name: Allamine Group

texts.fr:
ALLAMINE est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TIELE. Il regroupe 6 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées et ayant trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment alimentaire et des habillement et de la restauration l’image de KODIE, assise à gauche. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TIELE une des communes de la sous préfecture de BAGUINEDA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
KODIE est très connue à TIELE et excelle dans l’achat vente de la viande. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité importante de viande  auprès des bouchers de TIELE pour revendre dans  son restaurant sous forme de steak, de brochette et de ragoût, en détail, au comptant, à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 50000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Allamine is a group in the Benkadi association in Tiele. It is made up of 6 women who are all friends and relatives. They are all married, have an average age of 30 and 3 children on average. They are involved in various businesses such as buying and selling food supplies and clothing, and the restaurant business, like Kodie, who is sitting on the left. 

The group members live in large traditional families in Tiele, a town in the Baguineda sub-prefecture (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have been involved in small-scale business for several years and are much sought-after in their respective businesses. In order to satisfy the growing demands of customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan programme three years ago. This is their fifth solidarity loan. 

Kodie is well-known in Tiele and very good at buying and selling meat. She will use the loan to buy a large quantity of meat from butchers in Tiele to resell in her restaurant as steak, kebab and stew. She sells to individuals for cash, and her customers are men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Florecitas Group

texts.es: Doña Nolvia Dolores es miembro del Grupo Solidario Florecitas, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos y algunos aun dependen de ella, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Nolvia inicio hace 4 años con la venta de ropa, ella está solicitando este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropa con estilos que estén a la moda para así poder llamar la atención de sus clientes y de este modo pueda aumentar sus ventas. Ella comienza a trabajar desde las 6:00 A.M y regresa a las 6:00 P.M, su desventaja es que cuando da al crédito no siempre le pagan puntualmente y que para trasladarse lo hace a jalón, ya que sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante. Sus metas es tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijos a cubrir los gastos estudiantiles. Nolvia es clienta de FAMA desde hace varios ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Nolvia Dolores is a member of the "Florecitas" solidarity group. She is 36 years old, has 6 children and some of them are still dependent on her. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Four years ago Nolvia started selling clothes. She is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing clothes in fashionable styles, in order to call draw customers' attention. In this way she could increase her sales. She starts working at 6:00am and returns home at 6:00pm. 

Her disadvantage is that when she sells on credit, they don't always pay her on time. And as she is does door to door sales, she has to catch a ride. 

Her objective is to have more revenue, in order to help her children cover school expenses. Nolvia has been a client of FAMA for several loan cycles and she has cleared her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Mercedes Jacoba

texts.es: Mercedes, de 50 años de edad habita en la comunidad Momotombo en las afueras de León , casada, madre de tres hijos . Ella es comerciante y agricultora. Inicio con sus actividades cuando se caso. Su esposo le enseño a comercializar los productos que el sembrar asi como también el cuido de los animales y asi poco a poco fue aprendiendo del negocio con el que mantiene a su familia. Una de las actividades que mas le gusta es la crianza de animales en especial la de cerdos. Es por ello que solicita el crédito para compra de 4 cerdos reproductores y de desarrollo pues una actividad agrícola que deja buenas ganancias. A ella le gustaría tener bien establecido un buen numero de cerdos reproductores y de raza para venderlo en sectores cercanos a su comunidad además de poder invertir en las siembras de maíz. Pues su prioridad es darle una educación profesional a sus hijos
texts.en:
Mercedes, 50, lives in the community of Momotombo in the outskirts of León; she’s married and the mother of three children.  She’s a merchant and a farmer.  She started her activities when she got married.  Her husband taught her how to sell the products he grows as well as to care for animals.  Thus she gradually learned the business she supports her family with.

One of the activities she likes most is raising animals, especially pigs.  It’s because of this that she’s asking for a loan to buy four breeding pigs because this is an agricultural activity that produces good profits.  She’d like to have a good number of breeding, pedigree pigs to sell in sectors near her community and to be able to invest in corn crops.  Her priority is to provide her children with professional education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es: El señor Jesús de 48 años de edad  es soltero con 5 hijos de 23, 22, 18,15 y   31 años de edad   todos trabajan en la agricultura. Inicio sus actividades desde pequeño con su papá. A la edad de 21 años se fue  independizado  de sus padres,  su nivel académico es bien básico solo curso el primer grado de primaria a pesar de ello aprendió a leer y escribir bien, este ha sido siempre su único trabajo su producto lo comercializa en su comunidad no tiene otros ingresos.Su expectativas es sembrar además de  maíz  de riego, sembrar   hortalizas pues le va  ayudar a crecer en su negocio. Por esta razón está solicitando el crédito  para compra de insumos y fertilizantes para sembrar maíz y hortalizas.  Ya que con un buen mantenimiento en sus cultivos espera una producción de muy buenos rendimientos y calidad. El junto con sus hijos son trabajadoress que con sus esfuerzos propios ha sacado adelante la finca
texts.en: Jesús, 48, is single and has five children who are 23, 22, 18, 15 and 31 years old; they all work in agriculture.  He started his activities while still little with his father.  At the age of 21 he started to become independent from his parents.  His academic level is pretty basic; he only completed first grade in elementary school but despite that has learned to read and write well.  This has always been his only work.  He sells his products in his community and has no other source of income.   His hope is to plant more corn and vegetables because it will help his business grow.  Because of this he’s asking for the loan to buy supplies and fertilizer to plant corn and vegetables because with good crop care he expects very good, high quality crop yields.  He and his children are hardworking and have made their farm successful with their own efforts.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Nyagaach

texts.en:
Nyagaach lives in Bor.  She sells food from a stall, and has been in business for four years.  She is 35 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school.  

Nyagaach heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her second loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese Pounds (SDG) in order to purchase beans and onions.  She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Ajith

texts.en:
Ajith lives in Bor.  She sells food from a stall, and has been in business for four years.  She is 30 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school.  

Ajith heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her third loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 2500 Sudanese Pounds (SDG) in order to purchase beans and sugar.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru and this will be his second loan.  He used his first loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings.  He was able to plant and harvest and it was very profitable.  He plans to buy more fertilizer and seedlings as well as spraying chemicals for use in his farm.  

In the future, Joseph hopes to start large scale farming and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Akuol

texts.en:
Akuol is 33 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in Bor and sells charcoal, which she has been doing business for one year. 

Akuol is requesting her third loan from BRAC for 2,500 SDG, which she will use to purchase charcoal.  She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bolodobolo Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 femmes du groupe BOLODOBOLO ont en moyenne vingt neuf ans, deux enfants et vivent  dans des  familles, nucléaire à TIELE commune,de la sous préfecture de BAGUINEDA, relevant de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poissons, d’ habillements, riz, savons à l’image de KADIA qui la première à gauche
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, vingt cartons de savons. ELLE s’approvisionne a BAMAKO effectue sa vente, au  marché de TIELE et a domicile  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The 5 women in the Bolodobolo group are 29 years old on average, have an average of two children and live in nuclear families in Tiele, a town in the Baguineda sub-prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali). This is their second collaboration with the microfinance institute Soro Yiriwaso in order to help them satisfy their customer's needs. 

The women in the group sell items such as fish, clothing, rice or soap, like Kadia, pictured first on the left. With her loan, Kadia will buy 20 boxes of soap. She buys her supplies in Bamako and sells them at the market in Tiele or door-to-door. Her customers include men and women and they buy with cash or on credit. Kadia is hoping to make an average of 15,000 CFA francs per month, part of which will support her husband in paying daily expenses and part of which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Maria

texts.fr:
Madame MARIA est une femme mariée de 38 ans avec trois enfants et qui habitent à Ouéléssébougou (sous préfecture de la deuxième région du Mali) située à 80 kilomètres de Bamako.
Madame MARIA quitta l’école très tôt pour des raisons de mariage, elle  intégra le programme de prêt de groupe de Soro Yiriwaso  pour mieux entreprendre la vente de boissons en ambulant.
Elle est à son quatrième prêt après avoir correctement remboursés tous les trois précédents. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte constituer un stock important de boissons avec 700 casiers afin de faire une longue période sans rupture.
Elle est approvisionnée sur place par  ses fournisseurs. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 200.000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le paiement de ses échéances et subvenir à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
Madame MARIA  ambitionne dans les jours à venir, avec l’appui de Soro Yiriwaso ouvrir un sous dépôts de boissons pour faire la vente en gros.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives in Ouéléssébougou (a sub-prefecture of the 2nd administrative region of Mali), which is 80 km from Bamako. 

Maria left school very early due to marriage, and she is involved in the Soro Yiriwaso loan programme in order to improve her business selling drinks as an itinerant vendor. This is her fourth loan, and she has repaid all the others in full. With this loan she hopes to restock her business, buying 700 racks of drinks in order to be well-supplied for a long period of time. Her suppliers deliver directly to her.

Maria is expecting a monthly profit of 200,000 CFA francs, which she will use for repayments and daily costs. In the future, she hopes to be able to open a larger drinks store in order to sell in bulk.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Pan De Azúcar (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Pan de Azúcar está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador" y la ciudad cultural del país. Cuenca es una ciudad con mucha producción artesanal. Su gente es amable, cálida y gentil como nuestras socias quienes se dedican a laborar  en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ayudar y solventar los gastos de sus hogares.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jesenia, tiene 19 años, es casada y aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Jesenia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, actividad que la desempeña hace 4 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra cosméticos para ampliar su mercadería.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios secundarios.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que por motivos personales no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The "Pan de Azúcar" ["Sugarloaf"] communal bank is made up of 6 women and one man, who live in the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay province. Cuenca is known as the "Athens of Ecuador" and as the country's cultural city. Cuenca is also a city with a high level of handicraft production. Its people are friendly, warm and polite, as are our members, who work at various activities which allow them to supplement or cover the expenses of their households. 

One of the members of this group is Jesenia, who is 19 years old. She is married and as yet has no children. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not have a house of their own, so they live in rented quarters. 

Jesenia works selling cosmetics from a catalog. She has done this work for 4 years. She works from Sunday to Sunday without fixed working hours. 
 
She is in her second loan cycle with the communal bank, and she will invest the loan in buying cosmetics to expand her stock of merchanadise. 

Her goal is to finish her secondary education.

The small photo attached is of one of the members who could not be present when the group photo was taken, for personal reasons.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham, a 48-year-old married father of three children, two of whom are of school-going age, has been in farming for nearly 20 years, producing milk and maize for the local market. He says low production during dry seasons and animal diseases are his major business challenges.

Abraham has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. He says the income generated will go into providing for family's basic needs and educating the children. He hopes to own a van and start a transport business mainly delivering farmers' produce to the local market.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Aguer

texts.en: Aguer, a 30-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom attend school, lives in Bor where she has been operating a food stall for three years. Aguer, who heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, is now requesting her third loan for 1500 SDG to purchase onions and rice to sell. She will use the resulting extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and rice for resale.

loans.name: Elispha

texts.en:
Elispha is 29 years old and married to James. Together they have three children. She sells air time calling cards and has been in the business for the past six months.

This is her first term loan. She was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET LTD client. She will use the loan amount to purchase more air time calling cards for stock in her business.

Her hope is to establish her business in her own premises.

loans.use: to purchase more air time calling cards

loans.name: María Rossana

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 6 y 2 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas diarias y sobre todo en las mañanas que sus hijos están en la escuela, ella solo tiene que llevar al más pequeño ya que no tiene con quien dejarlo pero esto no le impide realizar sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa por catalogo ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Es fundadora del banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.

En la foto está la socia con su hijo.
texts.en:
In an area known as Las Piedras of Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo--known for its traditional culture, the happiness of its people, and its San Pedro and San Pablo festivals--the members of the communal bank Las Piedras gather every two weeks.

Here we meet María, who is 33 years old and married. From this marriage, she has three children, who are 12, 6, and 2 years old. The two oldest children are studying in high school and elementary school. Her husband is a driver.

She is a homemaker who, in order to have her own resources and with those help her husband with the household expenses, sells catalog clothing and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She sells door-to-door. She works three days a week for two to three hours a day, especially in the mornings when her children are in school. She only has to carry her youngest, as she does not have anyone with whom she can leave him. But this does not keep her from making her rounds, dropping off her products, and collecting every week. She has been doing this trade for a year, and it is going well.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and catalog clothing, as she has several orders to deliver.  She is the founder of the communal bank and would like the loan because loans are very important to her business. 
 
Her dream is to have a boutique.

She is shown in the photo with her son.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics y clothing.

loans.name: Javzanpagma

texts.en:
Javzanpagma, a 34-year-old hardworking woman, lives with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in a ger district which lacks basic infrastructure in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver for a local gas company, having previously worked for a public transportation company for nine years.

Javzanpagma started her business in 2005 by selling building materials at Tsaiz, the largest outdoor wood market in Mongolia, with a working capital of 2,000,000 MNT. She buys raw materials from a wood truck which comes from the countryside, and as a result of her hard work, she now has working capital of 7,800,000 MNT.

Javzanpagma is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy more wood for the upcoming season. Her business is very popular during the summer time, so she wants to purchase more wood as a reserve. Javzanpagma wants her children to get an excellent education and her goal for the upcoming year is to build a new small house for her family. A repeat and trusted client, she is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase wood for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 47 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  She is from Olkalou and is a farmer, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Lucy is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides.  She hopes to boost her farming business and get a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Soeng is a widow and has one son. She lives with her mother on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.  

Soeng is a silk weaver as is her mother. She is requesting a loan for $300, which she will use to purchase silk materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Nyandeng

texts.en:
Nyandeng is 37 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom attend school.  She lives in Bor and sells charcoal, which she has been doing for four years. 

Nyandeng is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC for 2,500 SDG, which she will use to buy charcoal.  She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gladis Asunción

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gladis, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos,  dos mayores de edad y dos de 17 años que son mellizos y estudian en colegio y son los que  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas).  Trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, esto lo viene realizando desde hace tres años en los cuales  le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela, lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y ropa. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Piedras communal bank meet every two weeks in a sector known as Las Piedras in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  The city is known for its traditional culture, its joyful people, and the San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas.

This is where we meet Gladis, age 46.  She is married and has four children.  Two of them are adults, and the two 17 year olds are twins.  They go to school and still live with her.  Her husband is a driver.

She sells clothes and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She works every day, mostly in the mornings.  This is because that is when it is easier for her to go along her route.  She sells door-to-door and by order.  She leaves products on credit, and she charges weekly.  

She has been doing this for three years, and it has gone very well for her.  She has plenty of customers.  She sells cosmetics and perfumes the most. 

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and clothes.  She has been in the communal bank since it started.  She likes it for the help they give with the loans in order to get ahead.

Her dream is to see her children finish their education and that they become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and clothes.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is single and has been in the transportation business for the last two years. Emmanuel had a friend who hired him a motorcycle. From this, he was able to raise funds to purchase a motorcycle, which brings him funds on a daily basis.

Emmanuel learned of Milango from his friends and decided to join in order to access credit for his business. He is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to repair the motorcycle and open a grocery stall. 

The current business faces challenges due to high fuel cost and competition from other motorcycle operators for the existing clients. This is the main reason which has prompted him to start another business. Emmanuel believes the extra income from this loan will help him enroll in an electrical course.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and open a grocery stall

loans.name: Matilde Alida

texts.en:
Matilde, age 39, is a single mother with two school-age children. She also cares for her nephew, whose parents are not able to support him. 

She initially started a business selling oil, milk, and soap. She had this business for seven years. Since she started receiving loans, she has been able to expand to a more profitable product. She now sells drinks in glass bottles. This is how most soft drinks and beer are sold in the Republic of Congo. Customers return the glass bottles to her and receive a discount on their next purchase of drinks. She will use the loan to buy more glass bottles and drinks for her business. 

Her greatest challenge is the initial cost of the expensive glass bottles and the transportation costs associated with carrying very heavy glass bottles. She hopes to one day grow her business large enough to purchase a vehicle to aid in transporting bottles. Her business strategy is to stock a large variety of drinks. She feels this has helped her acquire many customers. 

Matilde has received three previous loans from Kiva's partner HOPE Congo. She has a very good repayment record. She is grateful for the loans and hopes that the money she is now able to save will help her children to become educated and successful.

loans.use: to pay for glass bottles and drinks

loans.name: Ma. Brigida

texts.es: La señora Ma. Brigida, desde muy pequeña inico en el negocio ya que no tuvo los recursos para poder estudiar tenia que ayudar con los ingresos de su casa, actualmente vive con su hija y un nieto, es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora, desde hace 23 años que se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitacion, comienzan desde las 6:00 am cuando va al molino para preparar la masa y con la ayuda de su hija trabajan juntas para poder cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes de restaurantes, pulperias y personas que la visitan en su negocio, su sueño es poder ver a su nieto graduado de la universidad y que pueda tener las oportunidades que ella no pudo. Esta solicitando credito por valor de L. 12,000.00 para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y como su vivienda es de madera, necesita una parte del credito para la compra de cemento para realizarle unas mejoras y poder ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María Brigida started in the business when she was very young.  She did not have the resources to be able to go to school.  She had to help with the household income.

She currently lives with her daughter and a grandson.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman.  She has been making and selling tortillas in her house for 23 years.  She starts at 6:00 a.m. when she goes to the mill to prepare the dough.  Her daughter helps her, and they work together to fill her customers’ orders.  She has orders from restaurants, grocery stores, and people who visit her business.  Her dream is to be able to see her grandson graduate from the university.  She wants to see him be able to have the opportunities that she was not able to have.

She is requesting a loan for 12,000 lempiras to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder.  She has a wooden house, so she needs part of the loan to buy cement to make some improvements.  She wants to be able to offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for her business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 46 years old and married to Catherine. Together they have two school-going children. He operates a shop selling cereals in Naivasha.

Simon was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and he plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of assorted cereals to sell.

In the future, Simon hopes to open other cereal shops in Naivasha, thereby making more income and improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more cereals

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is married with four children. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand his planting area to get more output and pay school fees for the children.

In the background of the picture, there is a group of agriculture borrowers sitting behind Jean Damascene. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and labor support

loans.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has five children. Uba is a dairy farmer. She started her dairy business seven years ago. She bought a female calf, which has grown and given birth. She also engages in tree planting, a common business gaining acceptance within Malindi.

She was introduced to Milango last year by her friends, and she is now applying for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase animal feeds and to buy more trees for planting. The high transportation cost has been the major challenge for Uba. The additional income will help her meet emergency needs.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds and trees

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: La señora Erlinda, es soltera y vive con una nieta, siempre le ha gustado el negocio y  desde hace  40 años que se dedica a su Pulpería donde vende variedad de productos como ser, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, café, pan, leche, papel higiénico, jabón, refrescos y otros, atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana, sus clientes la prefieren por su buen trato ya que es muy amable y siempre esta sonriendo, realiza sus compras una vez por semana en el mercado de la comunidad. Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 20,000.00 para la compra de variedad de productos para su negocio y así poder ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, Gracias a los ingresos que recibe de su negocio ha logrado hacerle varias mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Erlinda is single and lives with a granddaughter. She has always enjoyed business and has had her grocery store for 40 years, where she sells a variety of products such as rice, beans, sugar, eggs, coffee, bread, milk, toilet paper, soap, beverages and other items. She waits on customers every day of the week. Her customers come to her because of her good service since she is very friendly and always smiling. She makes her purchases once a week at the market in her community. 

She is seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000.00 HNL for the purchase of a range of products for her business in order to be able to offer variety to her customers. Thanks to her income from her business she has been able to make a number of improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, coffee, soap, milk, oil, eggs and other items for her business.

loans.name: Alek

texts.en:
Alek lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children. Two of them are still in school. 

Alek heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Xiomara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Xiomara, vive con su esposo y un hijo, se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene más de un año de tener el negocio, inicio con la ayuda de su madre, con este ha logrado tener más ingresos para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de aceite, condimentos, arroz, carne, pollo, frijoles, pastas, gaseosas, para poder elaborar los platillos y mejorar la atención a la clientela.
La aspiración de Xiomara es que con este préstamo se pueda mejorar la producción en el negocio y atender más clientes.
texts.en:
Xiomara lives with her husband and son. She makes a living selling food, and has had the business for over a year. She started out with her mother’s help. With this, she has been successful in increasing her income in order to help her husband with the household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy oil, condiments, rice, meat, chicken, beans, pasta and soda pop in order to be able to make dishes and improve customer service. Xiomara’s aspiration is that with this loan she can increase the business’ output and serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy oil, condiments, rice, meat, chicken, beans, pasta and soda pop.

loans.name: Calle Bolívar (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle Bolívar se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de 9 socias y 2 socios que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos que recibieron pudieron mejorar en algo sus negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, artesanía, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Rosa, tiene 34 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esa relación tiene cuatro  hijos de 16, 13, 7 y  4 años  de edad, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido es maestro en soldadura.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja de viernes a domingo ya que en estos días es cuando encuentra a sus clientes y es cuando más vende, también realiza los cobros en estos días ya que deja a crédito y cobra por semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Lleva más de cinco años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien y ahora mejor desde que está recibiendo los créditos.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado para seguir adelante y aumentar su negocio.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando sus ventas.

La foto pequeña es de una de las socias que por motivos personales no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Calle Bolívar communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Cantón.  The canton is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are known on a national and international level.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat. 

This is a group of nine members and two other members who decided to join together to form this communal bank.  The bank has served them well because they were able to improve their businesses with the loans that they received.  The members devote themselves to different business activities like general commerce, handicrafts, services, food sales, and other businesses.

Rosa is one of the members of this group.  She is 34 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She has four children, ages 16, 13, 7, and 4.  The three oldest go to high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a master welder.

She is a very good housewife.  In order to help her husband with the household expenses she sells all types of clothes.  She sells door-to-door.  She works from Fridays through Sundays because this is when she can meet with her customers, and it is when she sells the most.  She also collects on these days because she leaves clothes on credit and collects weekly.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise each time she needs it.  She has been doing this business activity for over five years.  It has gone very well for her.  Now it is better since she is receiving the loans.

This loan is to buy pants, t shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes.  She has been in the communal bank since it started, and she likes it because of the help it has offered her in order to get ahead and increase her business.  Her dream is to continue increasing her sales.

The small photo is of one of the members who for personal reasons was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pants, t shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is 27 years old and married to Elizabeth. They have been blessed with one child. He is a vendor and sells new clothes. Through his hard work, he has been able to provide for his family’s needs. He plans to use this loan amount to buy more new clothes for sale in order to satisfy his customers' needs.

In the future, Collins hopes to expand his clothing business and later diversify to a motorbike transportation business. This will enable him to earn more income and buy a vehicle for his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for resale

loans.name: Alexandra Flor

texts.es:
Alexandra Flor tiene 23 años es soltera vive sus padres, no tiene hijos. Vive en Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La ventanilla se llama PITA se encuentra ubicada En el Recinto San Pablo de Pita perteneciente al Canton Caluma a 45 minutos de Montalvo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas a mantener los cultivos de naranja, guineo, orito, cacao y café. 

Alexandra se dedica a cuidar las plantaciones de cacao, guineo, naranja y cafe ya que estos productos son de ciclo largo, las compras las realiza en Comercial San Rafael en Caluma y las vende en Montalvo. 

El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como: abonos, urea, podas, limpieza del terreno de las malas hiervas y evitar enfermedades en los cultivos. El credito le ayudado a incrementar la calidad de los productos y evitar pérdidas en los cultivos. El sueño de Alexandra es comprar un terreno.


En las fiestas de carnaval le gusta salir en las comparsas.
texts.en: Alexandra Flor is 23 years old, single, lives with her parents, and has no children. She lives in Montalvo, Province of Los Ríos. The communal bank is called PITA and is located in Recinto San Pablo de Pita belonging to the Caluma Canton 45 minutes away from Montalvo. This bank devotes itself to agricultural labors, tending to crops of oranges, bananas, orito (wild bananas), cocoa and coffee. Alexandra devotes herself to tending crops of cocoa, bananas, oranges and coffee since these are long-cycle products. She makes her purchases at Comercial San Rafael in Caluma and sells in Montalvo. She is requesting her loan for purchase supplies such as fertilizers, plant nutrients, and for pruning and ridding the ground of weeds and avoiding diseases in the crops. The loans have helped her improve the quality of her product and avoid losses of the crops. Alexandra's dream is to purchase some land. During Carnival season she likes to go out dressed up in costume with a group.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, plant nutrients, and for pruning and ridding the ground of weeds and avoiding diseases in the crops.

loans.name: Gulkhumor

texts.ru: Гулхумор замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Более 10 лет она занимается шитьем женских национальных платьев. Она шьет на заказ. Кроме этого она занимается купле- продажей скота. Имеет 4 голов крупного рогатого скота. Гулхумор хотела бы получить займ для ремонта своего дома, с целью улучшения жилищных условий. Гулхумор надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Gulkhumor is married and a loving mother of two children.  She has been involved in sewing women's national dresses for over ten years.  She sews to order.  Besides this, she is involved in buying and selling livestock.  She has four heads of cattle.  Gulkhumor wants to obtain this loan to repair her house in order to improve living conditions.  Gulkhumor relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou est marié et âgé de vingt huit ans. Père d’un enfant il vit dans une famille monogame avec sa femme et son enfant à Ouelessebougou.
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans réussite, il décida de s’initier aux activités d’achat et de vente d’articles de quincaillerie.
Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complémentaires, il intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Actuellement il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après avoir remboursé sans difficulté le premier.
Il compte acheter avec ce prêt, une quantité importante d’articles de quincaillerie constitués : d’ampoules, de serrures, de peinture, de fer à béton et de ciment à Bamako, qu’il stock dans son magasin et vend au marché de Ouelessebougou, aux hommes et femmes. Il mène son activité durant toute l’année et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice de 200.000 F CFA par mois qu’il compte utiliser pour résoudre les dépenses de sa famille et investir dans son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou is a married 28-year-old.  The father of one child, he lives in a monogamous family with his wife and child in Ouelessebougou.  After unsuccessfully trying several business, he decided to begin retailing hardware items.  In search of additional financial resources, he joined Soro Yiriwaso's credit program.  He is currently on his second individual loan after paying back the first without difficulty.

With this loan, Mr. Seydou plans to buy a large quantity of hardware items, including light bulbs, locks, paint, concrete rebar, and cement in Bamako, which he will stock in his store and sell in the Ouelessebougou market.  His customers include both men and women.  He operates his business year-round and buys his products twice a month.

Mr. Seydou hopes to make a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA, which he plans to use to cover his family's expenses and to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy hardware items.

loans.name: Etibar

texts.ru: Etot molodoy chelovek kak vi videte na fotograrii zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Etibar 29 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey odin iz kotorix xodit v shkolku. Etibar jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. On 4 qoda nazad nachal zanimatsya pticevodstvom. Etibar nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. On xochet v budushem uvelichit pomesheniye svoyey fermi i svoy bizness. Etomu biznessu Etibar nauchilsya u svoyego starshego brata.
texts.en: This young person, as you can see on the photograph, is involved in poultry farming and breeds chickens.  Etibar is 29 years old, married and has two children, one of whom attends a school.  Etibar lives in the Baku region together with his beloved wife and children.  He became involved in poultry farming four years ago.  Etibar needs 1000 AZN to buy chickens in order to develop his business.  He wants to expand his farm space and his business in the future.  Etibar learned this business from his older brother.

loans.use: to buy chickens
